meanings.definition: To write one's name on a document as a way of showing agreement or approval.
meanings.sent1: She was signing the contract to buy a new house.
meanings.sent2: I will be signing the permission slip for the field trip tomorrow.
meanings.sent3: The dog seemed to be signing the adoption papers with a paw print.
meanings.sent4: The artist was signing the canvas with bold strokes of paint.
meanings.sent5: Signing the agreement felt like sealing a promise with ink.

meanings.definition: The act of communicating using sign language.
meanings.sent1: Her signing was clear and easy to understand.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's signing helped the students learn new words.
meanings.sent3: The monkey's signing impressed the visitors at the zoo.
meanings.sent4: The dancer's signing was like a beautiful silent performance.
meanings.sent5: Watching her signing was like seeing a secret language come to life.

meanings.definition: The act of making a gesture or motion to convey a message.
meanings.sent1: His signing of approval was a simple nod of the head.
meanings.sent2: The child's signing of hunger was rubbing their tummy.
meanings.sent3: The bird's signing for attention was flapping its wings excitedly.
meanings.sent4: The tree's signing in the wind was a gentle rustling of leaves.
meanings.sent5: The actor's signing of sadness was a slow lowering of the head.

meanings.definition: The act of hiring a person to a contract or agreement by having them sign a document.
meanings.sent1: The company's signing of new employees was a carefully planned process.
meanings.sent2: The manager's signing of the new recruit was met with cheers.
meanings.sent3: The robot's signing of the job offer was a futuristic touch screen interaction.
meanings.sent4: The team's signing of the star player was a game-changer.
meanings.sent5: The school's signing of the new principal brought fresh ideas to the community.
